intro: Masdevallia nigricans, commonly known as the black-veined masdevallia, is a striking orchid native to the cloud forests of South America. It is characterized by its dark, velvety petals and sepals that are often adorned with intricate, contrasting veins. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its flowers are usually fragrant and bloom in late winter or early spring. Due to its unique appearance and habitat requirements, it is a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
